metadata.description: Name of the App Service Plan
Enable Key Vault recovery (for existing deleted vaults)
Force application redeployment (change this value to trigger update)
GitHub PAT token for automatic workflow trigger (requires workflow: write permission, optional)

properties.scriptContent:
set -e
      echo "Setting up GitHub OIDC authentication for Azure deployment"
      echo ""
      echo "⚠️  REQUIRED PERMISSIONS:"
      echo "   - User Access Administrator role on subscription (for RBAC assignments)"
      echo "   - Application Administrator role in Azure AD tenant (for Entra app creation)"
      echo "   If these permissions are missing, deployment will fail with authorization errors"
      echo ""
      
      # Create Entra Application for GitHub OIDC
      echo "Creating Entra Application for GitHub OIDC..."
      APP_NAME="GitHub-OIDC-${WEBAPP_NAME}"
      
      # Create Azure AD application
      APP_RESPONSE=$(az ad app create \
        --display-name "$APP_NAME" \
        --sign-in-audience AzureADMyOrg)
      
      if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
        echo "ERROR: Failed to create Azure AD application"
        exit 1
      fi
      
      CLIENT_ID=$(echo "$APP_RESPONSE" | python3 -c "import sys, json; print(json.load(sys.stdin)['appId'])")
      APP_OBJECT_ID=$(echo "$APP_RESPONSE" | python3 -c "import sys, json; print(json.load(sys.stdin)['id'])")
      
      echo "✅ Created Azure AD Application: $CLIENT_ID"
      
      # Create service principal
      echo "Creating service principal..."
      SP_RESPONSE=$(az ad sp create --id "$CLIENT_ID")
      SP_OBJECT_ID=$(echo "$SP_RESPONSE" | python3 -c "import sys, json; print(json.load(sys.stdin)['id'])")
      
      echo "✅ Created Service Principal: $SP_OBJECT_ID"
      
      # Add federated identity credential
      echo "Adding federated identity credential for GitHub Actions..."
      CREDENTIAL_BODY=$(cat << EOF
{
  "name": "github-oidc",
  "issuer": "https://token.actions.githubusercontent.com",
  "subject": "repo:${GITHUB_REPO}:ref:refs/heads/${GITHUB_BRANCH}",
  "description": "OIDC login from GitHub Actions",
  "audiences": ["api://AzureADTokenExchange"]
}
EOF
)
      
      CREDENTIAL_RESPONSE=$(az rest \
        --method POST \
        --uri "https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/applications/$APP_OBJECT_ID/federatedIdentityCredentials" \
        --headers "Content-Type=application/json" \
        --body "$CREDENTIAL_BODY")
      
      if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
        echo "✅ Added federated identity credential"
      else
        echo "⚠️ Warning: Could not add federated credential (may already exist)"
      fi
      
      # Assign Contributor role to service principal on resource group
      echo "Assigning Contributor role to service principal..."
      az role assignment create \
        --assignee "$CLIENT_ID" \
        --role "Contributor" \
        --scope "/subscriptions/$SUBSCRIPTION_ID/resourceGroups/$RG_NAME"
      
      echo "✅ Assigned Contributor role"
      
      # Trigger GitHub Actions workflow (if PAT provided)
      if [ -n "$GITHUB_PAT" ] && [ "$GITHUB_PAT" != "" ]; then
        echo "=== TRIGGERING GITHUB ACTIONS WORKFLOW ==="
        echo "GitHub PAT provided, triggering deployment workflow..."
        
        WORKFLOW_FILE="deploy.yml"
        
        # Test GitHub API access
        TEST_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -H "Authorization: token $GITHUB_PAT" \
          "https://api.github.com/repos/$GITHUB_REPO")
        
        if echo "$TEST_RESPONSE" | grep -q '"name"'; then
          echo "GitHub API access successful"
          
          # Trigger workflow dispatch
          DISPATCH_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -w "%{http_code}" -o /tmp/dispatch_response.json \
            -X POST \
            -H "Authorization: token $GITHUB_PAT" \
            -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" \
            "https://api.github.com/repos/$GITHUB_REPO/actions/workflows/$WORKFLOW_FILE/dispatches" \
            -d "{\"ref\":\"$GITHUB_BRANCH\",\"inputs\":{\
            \"clientId\":\"$CLIENT_ID\",\
            \"tenantId\":\"$TENANT_ID\",\
            \"subscriptionId\":\"$SUBSCRIPTION_ID\",\
            \"resourceGroup\":\"$RG_NAME\",\
            \"webAppName\":\"$WEBAPP_NAME\"}}")
          
          HTTP_CODE="${DISPATCH_RESPONSE: -3}"
          
          if [ "$HTTP_CODE" = "204" ]; then
            echo "✅ Successfully triggered GitHub Actions workflow"
            echo "Workflow will deploy application using OIDC authentication"
            echo "Check workflow progress at: https://github.com/$GITHUB_REPO/actions"
          else
            echo "❌ Failed to trigger workflow. HTTP code: $HTTP_CODE"
            echo "Response: $(cat /tmp/dispatch_response.json 2>/dev/null || echo 'No response')"
            echo "Ensure PAT has 'workflow: write' permission"
          fi
        else
          echo "❌ GitHub API access failed"
        fi
      else
        echo "=== MANUAL WORKFLOW TRIGGER REQUIRED ==="
        echo "No GitHub PAT provided - trigger workflow manually"
        echo "Go to: https://github.com/$GITHUB_REPO/actions/workflows/deploy.yml"
        echo "Click 'Run workflow' and provide these inputs:"
        echo "  - clientId: $CLIENT_ID"
        echo "  - tenantId: $TENANT_ID"
        echo "  - subscriptionId: $SUBSCRIPTION_ID"
        echo "  - resourceGroup: $RG_NAME"
        echo "  - webAppName: $WEBAPP_NAME"
      fi
      
      echo ""
      echo "=== OIDC SETUP COMPLETE ==="
      echo "Infrastructure created successfully!"
      echo "Client ID: $CLIENT_ID"
      echo "Resource Group: $RG_NAME"  
      echo "Web App: $WEBAPP_NAME"
      echo ""
      if [ -n "$GITHUB_PAT" ] && [ "$GITHUB_PAT" != "" ]; then
        echo "GitHub Actions workflow should be starting automatically..."
      else
        echo "Trigger GitHub Actions workflow manually with the parameters above"
      fi
      echo "App URL will be available after deployment: https://$(az webapp show --name $WEBAPP_NAME --resource-group $RG_NAME --query defaultHostName -o tsv 2>/dev/null || echo "$WEBAPP_NAME.azurewebsites.net")"
      
      # Output CLIENT_ID for ARM template outputs (DeploymentScript result)
      echo "{\"clientId\": \"$CLIENT_ID\"}" > $AZ_SCRIPTS_OUTPUT_PATH
